Description: NOTICE OF EX PARTE COMMUNICATIONS Pursuant to Rule 8.4 of the Rules of Practice and Procedure of the California Public Utilities Commission, Ava Community Energy, California Choice Energy  Authority, Clean Power Alliance, Marin Clean Energy, Peninsula Clean Energy Authority, San Diego Community Power, San Jose Clean Energy, and Sonoma Clean Power Authority (collectively, the Joint CCAs) hereby provide notice of the following ex parte meetings: Arnold Son, Advisor to Commissioner Karen Douglas, and Kourtney Vaccaro, Chief of Staff to Commissioner Karen Douglas, met with the Joint CCAs on Tuesday, April 15, 2025, from 1:00 p.m. to 1:30 p.m. by video conference. Nikhil Vijaykar, Partner, Keyes & Fox LLP; Neal Reardon, Director of Regulatory Affair, Sonoma Clean Power Authority; Wade Stano, Senior Policy Counsel, Marin Clean Energy; Dean Kinports, Senior Strategic Policy Manager, San Diego Community Power; Jana Kopyciok-Lande, Associate Director, Innovation Strategy, Peninsula Clean Energy Authority; Claire Huang, Regulatory Analyst, Ava Community Energy; Clark McIsaac Advisor, Regulatory Affairs, Clean Power Alliance; Steven Jimenez, Legislative Affairs Specialist, San Jose Clean Energy; and Scott Blaising, Attorney, Braun Blaising & Wynne P.C. attended this meeting on behalf of the Joint CCAs. 2.Andrew Klutey, Advisor to Commissioner John Reynolds, met with the Joint CCAs on Wednesday, April 16, 2025, from 3:00 p.m. to 3:30 p.m. by video conference. Nikhil Vijaykar, Partner, Keyes & Fox LLP; Neal Reardon, Director of Regulatory Affair, Sonoma Clean Power Authority; Wade Stano, Senior Policy Counsel, Marin Clean Energy; Dean Kinports, Senior Strategic Policy Manager, San Diego Community Power; Jana Kopyciok-Lande, Associate Director, Innovation Strategy, Peninsula Clean Energy Authority; Claire Huang, Regulatory Analyst, Ava Community Energy; Clark McIsaac Advisor, Regulatory Affairs, Clean Power Alliance; Marcos Santiago, Senior Customer Programs Specialist, San Jose Clean Energy; Scott Blaising, Attorney, Braun Blaising & Wynne P.C.; and Kathy Wells, Regulatory Manager, California Choice Energy Authority attended this meeting on behalf of the Joint CCAs. 3.Nick Dahlberg, Advisor to President Alice Busching Reynolds, met with the Joint CCAs on Thursday, April 17, 2025, from 11:30 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. by video conference. Nikhil Vijaykar, Partner, Keyes & Fox LLP; Wade Stano, Senior PolicyCounsel, Marin Clean Energy; Zae Perrin, VP of Customer Operations, Marin Clean Energy; Dean Kinports, Senior Strategic Policy Manager, San Diego Community Power; Jana Kopyciok-Lande, Associate Director, Innovation Strategy, Peninsula Clean Energy Authority; Claire Huang, Regulatory Analyst, Ava Community Energy; Clark McIsaac Advisor, Regulatory Affairs, Clean Power Alliance; Marcos Santiago, Senior Customer Programs Specialist, San Jose Clean Energy; Steven Jimenez, Legislative Affairs Specialist, San Jose Clean Energy; Scott Blaising, Attorney, Braun Blaising & Wynne P.C.; and Kathy Wells, Regulatory Manager, California Choice Energy Authority attended this meeting on behalf of the Joint CCAs.

Administrative Law Judge’s Ruling on Natural Resources Defense Council’s Showing of Significant Financial Hardship. Natural Resources Defense Council has satisfied the eligibility requirements of Pub. Util. Code § 1804(a). Natural Resources Defense Council has shown significant financial hardship. Natural Resources Defense Council is preliminarily determined to be eligible for intervenor compensation in this proceeding. However, a finding of significant financial hardship in no way ensures compensation.

Assigned Commissioner’s Ruling Seeking Party Comment on Renewable Generation Fuels and Technologies. A workshop on renewable generation technologies is scheduled for November 12, 2020 from 1:00 pm to 5:00 pm. Parties are directed to file opening comments on the questions contained in this ruling no later than November 18, 2020 and Reply Comments no later than November 24, 2020. Opening Comments shall be limited to 15 pages and reply comments shall be limited to 5 pages.

Assigned Commissioner’s Scoping Memo and Ruling. The scope and schedule of this proceeding are as set forth. The record established in Rulemaking 12-11-005 on Self-Generation Incentive Program renewable generation and heat pump water heater technologies is incorporated into this proceeding. A Self-Generation Incentive Program Technical Working Group Process Streamlining sub-group is established with the scope, organization and timeline as described above. Evidentiary Hearings are not needed. The category of the proceeding is quasi-legislative. Comments on question (a) provided in section 3 shall be filed and served no later than 5 days from issuance of this Scoping Memo and Ruling. Reply comments on question (a) in section 3 will not be accepted. Comments on questions (b) – (k) provided in section 3 shall be filed and served no later than 30 days from issuance of this Scoping Memo and Ruling. Reply comments on questions (b) – (k) provided in section 3 shall be filed and served no later than 45 days from issuance of this Scoping Memo and Ruling.
